Player.title: Player
Player.description: Represents a player in the ScoreSync application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Player entity.

definition.description: Stores player data. Allows real-time updates of player scores and deletion by admins. 'playerId' is the unique identifier for each player.

params.name: playerId
params.description: Unique identifier for the player document.

definition.description: A document in this collection signifies that the user with the corresponding UID has admin privileges. Existence of the document is what confers the role; the content is irrelevant.

params.name: uid
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user who has admin privileges.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support a real-time, multi-player score system (ScoreSync). It prioritizes simplicity, security, and real-time updates using Firebase.  It uses a single collection for players. The structure facilitates efficient queries for ranking and provides a clear security model.

**Authorization Independence:** The design does not require authorization checks that rely on hierarchical data (`get()` calls in rules). All necessary data for validating operations is present within each document, which is especially important for atomic operations and managing data consistency.

**QAPs Support:**
*   Secure `list` operations are supported by the segregation of player data into its own collection. This ensures that `list` operations can be performed securely with rules applied at the collection level.
*   The design uses path-based ownership for global data, enforcing that write access is restricted based on rule definitions (admin role or updates to individual scores).

**Invariants:**
*   The structure supports the integrity of scores by allowing score updates only through increments controlled by rules.
*   The name is assumed to be unique and invariant.
